snippet: The Met is beefing up its Spanish collection with the purchase of “The Penitent Saint Peter,” just the second canvas by Jusepe de Ribera to enter its collection.
abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Metropolitan Museum of Art is adding to its Spanish Collection with purchase of The Penitent Saint Peter painting by Jusepe de Ribera; paintings of artist Jack Goldstein are displayed at the Jewish Museum in New York; Public Art Fund is extending project by Japanese artist Tatzu Nishi involving statue of Christopher Columbus in New York City's Columbus Circle by two weeks, to accommodate those who could not see the exhibit due to Hurricane Sandy.
lead_paragraph: The Met is beefing up its Spanish collection with the purchase of “The Penitent Saint Peter,” just the second canvas by Jusepe de Ribera to enter its collection.
